topics.title: Hub
topics.content:
Hub is layer 1 device that connects one or two computers. A hub is usually termed as a ‘dumb’ device because when a hub receives data, it simply sends data to every other connected device, regardless of the intended recipient; in other word it broadcasts the data across all the connected devices.

topics.title: Switch
topics.content: switch is a layer 2 device that connects one or two computers. A switch send the data to the intended device based on mac address (it unicast the data)
